contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "your storehouses will be full" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: your storehouses will be filled up

contextId.information: This can be put into active form. AT: "God made me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I was made

contextId.information: "Before the bases of the mountains were put into place." This can also be put into active form. AT: "Before God made the foundations of the mountains and put them into their proper places" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Before the mountains were settled

contextId.information: This can be put into active form. AT: "when God set the limit for the foundations of the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when there was set the limit for the foundations of the dry land

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God keeps away from trouble the person who does what is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The righteous person is kept away from trouble

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT:"No one can become safe and secure by doing what is wicked" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A person cannot be established by wickedness

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will overthrow the wicked people" or "People will remove the wicked people from power" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Wicked people are overthrown

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will praise those who have wisdom" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A person is praised by how much wisdom he has

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "evil actions push over" or "evil actions destroy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: is brought down by his evil actions

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that is something that people despise" or "that is something that Yahweh despises" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that is something to be despised

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what someone has taught them" or "what they have learned" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what they are taught

contextId.information: This person will have a reputation of being a discerning person. This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will call the one who is wise in heart discerning" or "The one who is wise in heart will have a reputation of being a discerning person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The one who is wise in heart is called discerning

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "A person throws the lots into his lap" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The lots are thrown into the lap

contextId.information: This can be written in active form. AT: "The tongue can lead to life of death" or "What people say can lead to life or death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Death and life are controlled by the tongue

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "many friends--they will bring him to ruin" or "many friends--his friends will destroy him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: many friends is brought to ruin by them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Children inherit a house and wealth from their parents" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A house and wealth are inherited from parents

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People know a young man by his actions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Even a youth is known by his actions

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Bread that someone gained by deceit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Bread gained by deceit

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People establish plans based on advice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Plans are established by advice

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "When someone punishes the mocker" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When the mocker is punished

contextId.information: These words can be translated in active form. AT: "A person should choose a good name rather than great riches" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A good name is to be chosen over great riches

contextId.information: These words can be translated in active form. AT: "God will bless the one who has a generous eye" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The one who has a generous eye will be blessed

contextId.information: These words can be translated in active form. AT: "those whom they are taking away," where "they" could be anyone, but are probably government officials. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who are being taken away

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) this is a simple passive that can be translated as in active form. AT: "no one will take your hope away" or 2) this is litotes that can be translated in positive form. AT: "your hope will surely continue" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: your hope will not be cut off

contextId.information: These words can be translated in active form. AT: "Someone who is patient can persuade a ruler" or "Someone who is patient can speak to a ruler and change his mind" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: With patience a ruler can be persuaded

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form."You will not be able to correct a slave simply by talking to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A slave will not be corrected by words

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "he will prove that you are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be proved to be

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the ravens of the valley will peck out his eyes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: his eyes will be pecked out by the ravens of the valley

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the vultures will eat him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he will be eaten by the vultures

contextId.information: That is, people rightly hated her before she married; once she marries, she will be worse than she was before she married. This can be translated in active form. AT: "a woman whom good people have hated when she marries" or "an outcast woman when she marries" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a hated woman when she marries

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "what God has decreed" or 2) "what the kings themselves have decreed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: what has been decreed

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. The verb "know" is a metonym for respect. AT: "People respect her husband" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Her husband is known
